intro: Couepia marleneae, commonly known as the Marlene's couepia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
